name: ListPagerdutyExtensions
description:
Retrieve a list of existing Pagerduty extensions.

This tool retrieves existing extensions in Pagerduty, which are representations of Extension Schema objects attached to Services. It is useful for managing or viewing integrations related to services in your Pagerduty account.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to accept using the 'Accept' header for versioning purposes.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Sets the Content-Type of the request, typically 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of extensions to retrieve per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination of search results. Use this to skip a specified number of items.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: filter_by_name_query
parameters.description: Filters results to show only records whose name matches the given query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: filter_by_extension_object_id
parameters.description: Filter results by the specific extension object's ID.

value_schema.description: The id of the extension object you want to filter by.

parameters.name: filter_by_extension_vendor_id
parameters.description: Filter the extensions by the ID of the extension vendor.

value_schema.description: Filter the extensions by extension vendor id.

parameters.name: include_additional_details
parameters.description: Specify additional details to include, such as 'extension_objects' or 'extension_schemas'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to include the total count of records in the response; otherwise, it will be null for faster response times.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: extension_object_id
parameters.description: The id of the extension object you want to filter by.

value_schema.description: The id of the extension object you want to filter by.

parameters.name: extension_schema_id
parameters.description: Filter the extensions by extension vendor id.

value_schema.description: Filter the extensions by extension vendor id.

parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
